title: Yechan David Kim
text:
Hello! My name is Yechan D. Kim, and I am a current undergraduate student studying Applied Mathematics-Economics and International and Public Affairs at Brown University, where I have completed and excelled in courses involving data computing, cybersecurity, mathematics, and religious history. I formerly ran an online journal as its president and editor-in-chief and completed an internship at Samsung International, where I gained hands-on experience at one of the world’s leading AI innovators. I am located in San Diego, and you may find me reading medieval history, pondering theology, arguing philosophy, downloading random apps on GitHub, or generally being unemployed.
Currently, I am working with UCSD Professor Edward J. Watts, Chair in Byzantine Greek History and Co-Director of the Center for Hellenic Studies, on various AI projects to assist with his research. In particular, I developed an AI-powered database that summarizes documents and extracts key information to automatically generate a network diagram and a search feature. This AI search allows users to query any uploaded scholarly article and provides results supplemented with direct quotes. Furthermore, I developed a tool called “Eusebiask” in which an AI version of the church historian Eusebius responds to inquiries based on his Life of Constantine and Church History.
